text:
public service announcement:
`svg` > `filters` > `feComposite` is an expensive operation and Firefox can’t handle it. That was a 3 hour ~lesson~ _beating in the face_
Woah, I want to know how you tracked that down

Wow, I’ve genuinely never heard of anyone using `feComposite` in the wild — that’s the kinda thing that can only come about writing SVG by hand. Any vector editing tool would flatten the output and turn it into masks and groups.

Any chance you’d care to benchmark `feConvolveMatrix` so long as you’re reviewing the computational cost of SVG functionality that nobody has ever used? :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:
Lol. Tomorrow <@U04AQA0QM8E>. For today my brain needs a break. But now I am curious
